text: Hélène Guisan-Démétriadès, née Démétriadès (born 16 November 1916, in Constantinople) is a Vaud writer, poet and teacher. She came to Switzerland at the age of six. After studying literature and years of teaching Ancient Greek, she married the Vaud councilor . Guisan-Démétriadès translated Greek tragedies into French and wrote many articles of spiritual reflection. She is also the author of La Tierce présence a work which was awarded the Prix Ève Delacroix of the Académie française in 1995. == Sources== * in the Cantonal and University Library of Lausanne * Back page of Les Carnets du silence (2002) * A D S - Autorinnen und Autoren der Schweiz - Autrices et Auteurs de Suisse - Autrici ed Autori della Svizzera == External links == * Hélène Guisan- Démétriadès on the site of the Académie française * Les carnets du silence on La Procure Category:Swiss women poets Category:Swiss writers Category:1916 births Category:Constantinopolitan Greeks Category:Swiss centenarians Category:Swiss people of Greek descent Category:Living people Category:Women centenarians
